intro: Baphorhiza orientalis, commonly known as the oriental baphorhiza, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices, where it can access adequate moisture. Its botanical features include a short, creeping stem and palmate leaves with a hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Baphorhiza orientalis is considered a species of conservation concern.
